doc.after: In Germany admission to medical schools is currently administered jointly by the Stiftung f r Hochschulzulassung SfH a centralized federal organization and the universities themselves The most important criterion for admission is the Numerus clausus the final GPA scored by the applicant on the Abitur highest secondary school diploma However in light of the recent gain in influence of medical schools in regards to applicant selection additional criteria are being used to select students for admission These criteria vary among medical faculties and the final Abitur GPA is always a core indicator and strongly influences admission Admission remains highly competitive A very small number of slots per semester are reserved for selected applicants which already hold a university degree Zweitstudium and for medical officer candidates Sanit tsoffizieranw rter
